member.name: T:NetSteps.Encore.Core.Log.ILogSink

member.summary: Tracks whether this module has been wired up.
member.remarks: This mechanism only exists because of the chicken-and-egg relationship between the root IoC container and the wireup coordinator. It enables the IoC container to see whether the wireup has been triggered on this assembly and enables it to "auto-wire" in cases where the library is included in a project that is ignorant of the wireup dependency logic.

member.name: T:NetSteps.Encore.Core.Parallel.Continuation
member.summary: Continuation delegate.
member.param: an exception raised by the operation
member.remarks: Continuations are invoked when the operation on which they depend reaches completion. Continuations always receive an exception as their first argument. In success cases, the argument will be null; otherwise it is the exception raised by the operation being continued.

member.summary: Creates a new instance.

member.summary: Creates a new instance.
member.param: indicates whether to occasionally yield a busy reactor
indicates yield frequency when yielding a busy reactor

member.name: P:NetSteps.Encore.Core.Parallel.ReactorOptions.MaxDegreeOfParallelism
member.summary: The reactor's max degree of parallelism. This option controls the maximum number of concurrent threads used to react to items pushed to the reactor.

member.name: P:NetSteps.Encore.Core.Parallel.ReactorOptions.YieldBusyReactor
member.summary: Whether the reactor yields busy reactor threads. This option can provide better parallelism when the entire thread pool is busy.

member.name: P:NetSteps.Encore.Core.Parallel.ReactorOptions.YieldFrequency
member.summary: Indicates the frequency at which a reactor thread yields.
member.remarks: Generally speaking, when a reactor is configured to yield, each thread pool thread will react to at most YieldFrequency items before yielding the thread back to the pool.

member.name: P:NetSteps.Encore.Core.Parallel.ReactorOptions.MaxParallelDepth
member.summary: Maximum parallel depth.
member.remarks: For busy reactors, borrows the callers thread when the maximum parallel depth is reached.

member.name: P:NetSteps.Encore.Core.Parallel.ReactorOptions.DispatchesPerBorrowedThread
member.summary: Sequential dispatches per borrowed thread.
member.remarks: For busy reactors, when borrowing the caller's thread, the number of items to process before returning control to the caller.

member.name: P:NetSteps.Encore.Core.Process.ProcessIdentifyConfigurationSection.Environment
member.summary: Indicates the name of the environment in which the application is executing. The meaning of "environment" is up to the user but in general indicates an environment such as: { dev | test | stage | prod }. In cases where events in one environment can be heard by journalers in another environment the presence of this value in an event helps with filtering.
